p: Whether preventive therapy with steroids would be a more manageable strategy is complicated by the fact that timing of the immune response ranges from 4â€“10 weeks post vector delivery and depends on the vector serotype. However, it seems that, for a given serotype, the time of immune response onset is very consistent. Thus, if one subject developed immune responses, all subsequent subjects in the same dose cohort could receive prophylactic immunosuppression.
